comments.body: Can you make it clearer where the feature is used (cursory look I see TH1F vs TStatistic which don't seem to be linked)? (i.e. what am I missing?)

I don't understand the comment.
I generate a column b which is of type TH1F and read it as a column of TH1.
I generate a column x of TStatistic, dump on disk the obtained dataset, create a RDF on top of it, read the column x as TObject.

My point is that the first one is 'buried'/'hidden' on line 97  with a missing 'F' on column 35.  I did not 'spot' (and probably auto-corrected it :) ), so adding a comment like
```
// Read the TH1F as a TH1
```
might help.

The 2nd one look (on the surface) as a mistake (because of the cast).

In either case, it is obvious to you that the system will pick up the signature to restrict/constraint the problem but a cursory read would lead to the 'but-of-course-you-can-call a function taking a TH1* with a TH1F* star' ....

> a cursory read would lead to the 'but-of-course-you-can-call a function taking a TH1* with a TH1F* star' 

Exactly! users expect it to be possible, but it wasn't until now
